revised_title: Spontaneous Generation of Heat in Recently Hardened Steel: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This study investigates the spontaneous generation of heat in various types of steel, including carbon tool steel and tungsten-chromium steel, after being hardened and quenched. The research shows that the rate of heat generation diminishes over time, and the heat generation is not caused by the shrinking of the steel. The findings have implications for understanding the thermal properties of steel and its applications in various industries.
